Financial constraints and budget overruns, which can lead to delays in construction and quality issues.
Unforeseen site conditions, such as unstable soil or rock, that require additional engineering and structural work.
Labor shortages or strikes, which can lead to delays in construction and quality issues.
Weather-related delays, such as heavy rain or extreme temperatures, which can impact construction progress and safety.
Changes in building codes and regulations during construction, which can require costly and time-consuming modifications to the design.
